contentfulGlobalResourceContainer.resourceTitle: Open Source Hardware in PK-12 Education Literature Review Data

translatedResources.title: Open Source Hardware in PK-12 Education Literature Review Data

body.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The literature review shows what, where, and how OSH is being used in PK-12 learning. The OSH technologies included in this review are robotics, science lab equipment, 3D printers, and e-textiles. It is concluded that these technologies are shown to further students’ learning by enabling them to build the technologies themselves.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The attached sheet provides the data used for the conclusions drawn in the literature review. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

shortDescription.shortDescription: Open-source hardware (OSH) is a low-cost innovative alternative to commercial hardware technologies. Within the education system, these technologies are used to better students’ learning without traditional costs.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Open-source hardware (OSH) is a low-cost innovative alternative to commercial hardware technologies. Within the education system, these technologies are used to better students’ learning without traditional costs.
